question.text: Which of the following pairs represents linkage isomers?

options.text: <math><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced><mi> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d </mi><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2 </mn></mrow></msub><mi> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d </mi><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>

<math><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4 </mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced><mi> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d </mi><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></math>

solution.text: As <math><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo></mrow></msup></math> is an ambidentate ligand and it can be linked through N or S so it is capable of showing linkage isomerism so <math><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></math> are linkage isomers.
